awd_titl_txt: Experiments on Molecular Structure Using NMR Spectrometry
awd_abstract_narration: Through this project, the institution purchased an NMR to improve               the students' understanding of molecular structure, particularly                of organic compounds.  The chemistry faculty revised existing                   experiments to take advantage of the equipment, and they added                  new experiments emphasizing principles of molecular structure                   such as applications of NMR to biochemical kinetics and cation                  hydration constants by proton NMR.  Facilities for undergraduate                research were greatly enhanced by the acquisition.  In addition,                the equipment was used for the institution's "Saturday Seminar"                 program for high school teachers and students and for junior                    college faculty and students in the area.                                                                                                                       The institution contributed to the project in an amount equal to                the NSF funds.
